reviews.text: Arrived ahead of the anticipated date. Instructions were easy to follow and it assembled fairly quickly. Customer service is providing a replacement for the paddle shaft (one of two) that did not function properly.

reviews.text: We took these out for our first trip and spent about 2.5 hrs paddling around a lake.  They were very stable even for one over the weight limit and very easy for all to paddle.  Our 11 yr old had her own for the first time and did great in it.  Very pleased with the product and the cost.  Comes with everything including a bag to store in.
reviews.title: Great value for the money.

reviews.text: These come 2 per package. I installed them on a utility trailer and they work great!
reviews.title: Great Value!!

reviews.text: The convenience of being able to take this thing literally anywhere is amazing. With ponds and lakes I couldn't access from ashore, I can now go with this kayak easily. It's awesome to be able to take any my buddies with me without sacrificing room and I'm 5'10. Easily one of my favorite purchases in a while, if you're thinking about buying this I would suggest you go for it!!!
reviews.title: A very affordable fishing kayak :)

reviews.text: Great for lengthy wilderness trips: lightweight means easier portages, slower travel but more stable than traditional canoes, nice for a big man going solo. Get a longer, 290 to 300cm kayak paddle to reduce water drippage inside, always carry pump and patch kit.
reviews.title: Stable, tough, lightweight

reviews.text: Boat is awesome! I am 6ft 4in and 350lbs and this thing is perfect. You will need the longer oars like 230mm or so. The rod holders beat up your hands when paddling. For the money this thing is great! I feel 100% comfortable after building a pvc frame for the seat back. The seat that comes with it has minimal support at best for big guys. Rows straight and reasonably speedy. I cannot keep up with the harder rotomolded units. Blows up very quick with air mattress pump.
reviews.title: Great Kayak for big men

reviews.text: This is a great little boat very stable and easy to paddle.

I got this boat a few months ago and I am really happy with it. Setup is easy and fast and it is just as easy and quick to store. I found that paddling was rough for me due to the distance I travel on the river. So I purchased the Sevylor trolling motor. Just take it out the box put on the prop and mount it on the side as indicated. Its a little tight for two adults but it is perfect for one adult. Just remove the other seat and you are ready to go. Once you figure out were to store your gear for comfort you'll be very satisfied with this kayak. Its tough as nails. Ive gone over stumps and fallen trees in the river and it just keeps on going. I also use a 26lb deep cycle battery and a battery power box with fit perfectly on the rear behind my seat. I use it just about every morning if the weather is good before I go to work. Well worth the money and great investment for someone who does not have a place to store a boat or kayak at home. This thing fits right in the trunk of my Altima along with everything I mentioned above to include life jacket, Portable livewell , anchor, two fishing pole which fit perfectly in the rear rod holders. I get a lot of questions about it were I fish. People are surprised when I tell them I purchased it at Walmart and the price. What gets them though is how fats it sets up and how easy it is to role up and put in the bag put in the trunk and ride off into the sunset. Love my boat.
reviews.title: Great Inflatable KAYAK

reviews.text: Easy to set up and easy to deflate and transport. Very stable for lake use. You will get many compliments and questions when people see you with this boat. 100% satisfied.
reviews.title: Fantastic Canoe/Kayak

reviews.text: I was very pleased with the quality of this product. The material is heavy and well-made, and the kayak itself is quite well-equipped. There is one drawback, however. Because an inflatable cannot really have recessed rod holders, all of the attachments (including the paddle holders) project out. That is all well and good while fishing, but it creates real problems when paddling -- it is very difficult to paddle smoothly without banging your hand or paddle against one of the projections. Therefore, if you are primarily going to be cruising, and fishing is just a sidelight, you would be much better off buying the regular Colorado model without these fishing attachments.
reviews.title: Excellent With One Qualification

reviews.text: I COULD NOT BELIEVE THAT YOU SOLD ME THIS BOAT WITHOUT PADDLES AND AIR PUMP! I MIGHT HAVE MISSED IT BUT YOU SHOULD INFORM THE BUYER THAT THIS BOAT DOESNT COME WITH ANYTHING TO BE USEABLE

reviews.text: I love this kayak other than the whole Boston valve issue. There are 3 sections with Boston valves for filling air. The center Boston valve is a different size from the two on the sides. Don't lose that center one. It is not the "standard" Boston valve size (whatever that is). Quite the design flaw. I lost that center one and I have been having a very hard time finding the right size to replace it. If anyone knows where I can find the right size to replace it, please let me know.

Very uncomfortable. Difficult to enter and exit. Pole holders droop till the pole is in the water. Seats have zero support. Not fit for fishing. Took it back to Walmart for a refund after 2 tries. Totally disappointed.

The bad about the kayak is you need to upgrade your seats and you hit the pole holders when you try to paddle. Overall a very good kayak little slow in the water but that's to be expected from an inflatable

reviews.text: I absolutely love this kayak!  I was hesitant at first...I mean... "Inflatable"? Really? I am glad I listened to the other voice in my head! I am so happy with this purchase. I was happy to return the "look" as I simply wiped mine off, folded it up and put it in my trunk - while they struggled to wiped theirs off, drain it and hoist it up to the top of their cars and onto the rack. :0) Not to mention getting it out of the water!  I simply picked mine up and carried it! Traveling with this kayak will be a breeze!  Best $$ I've spent in a very long time!  KAYAK ON!!!! :0)

reviews.text: Nice overall but feels like it could tip easily. Also did not come with a cover to the self bailing water drain at the back of the kayak so water can easily get in.

Cons: for two adults, this is just next to impractical. The product description is pretty misleading - it says it can snugly fit two adults. I'm 5' 10", my girlfriend is 5' 6".  We're not tall people. 

The boat is about 8" too short to actually fit us snugly. To even try it, I need to tuck my feet in against the sides of her seat, with my toes almost touching her leg. She needs to squeeze her feet all the way to the front. Even then, our knees are too high to paddle comfortably, and with our feet squeezed in like that, we can only sit in there for 10-15 min before needing to get out. 

The far more accurate description would that the 330 can handle 2 people *snugly* with a maximum total height between the two adults of 11 feet. 

RE some other common questions - I think set up can be done in 15-20 minutes, once you know what you're doing. Break down is a little faster because it deflates quickly.

Pros - incredibly highly rated on across a bunch of kayaking sites for an inflatable kayak. You should strongly consider this kayak if you're looking for an inflatable kayak.
reviews.title: Far too small for two adults (by about 1 foot)

reviews.text: We bought this for my son's 8th birthday.  It was all he wanted this year.  He took it out on the lake once and one of the main back plugs fell out causing the kayak to fill up with water rendering it pretty useless for the day.  The one "Lifetime" sticker on the kayak is about to fall off.  I called and spoke with a customer service agent and although he was super nice and very apologetic he was also shocked that the company had stickers on the kayaks and not metal signs like they had in the past.  If I had to guess, all of the these 5 stars reviews got the older models and not what my poor kiddo has.  I would say "you get what you pay for" but it was pretty expensive.  They are going to ship an extra plug to our house, but they are back ordered and apparently they don't have extra signs or stickers to give us.  My son is pretty disappointed.
reviews.title: Not holding up well

reviews.text: After receiving the kayak late i started pumping it up when i noticed that it had a hole on one side not good

I bought this kayak since it fell well in my budget. Here are the problems that I faced with it.
1. The inflating pump failed on the very first time of use. The pump isn't strong enough for the boat. I had to buy a strong air pump.
2. I was able to use the boat only twice before it started getting punctured in the bottom bed. The puncture develops at the corner place where the melted line ends. It's manufacturing defect for sure. I got 4 punctures of this kind one after the another. 
3. The puncture patch supplied in the package is not good enough. I had to buy an exclusive vinyl patch kit. 
4. while inflating, the bottom bed's one of the melted slit section just came off and the kayak was tilting up on the right. 
Now the boat is useless after using it for only 5 times. 
I wouldn't recommend this product at all after facing so many troubles within so very less usage. 
I m thinking of purchasing the hard plastic canoe now.
reviews.title: Gets punctured repeatedly.

reviews.text: Love this! It is very sturdy and strong. Highly recommend it.

We received our kayak within 3 to 5 days after ordering. That was wonderful since we were going camping right away. It was pretty fast blowing it up. Then we got right out on the lake. The middle seat does not support much. Since I have a steel rod in my spine...I need to sit more upright. So I removed the middle seat and moved it to the back for more support. It worked excellent!!! Definitely worth the little bit of money that you pay for it!!! Would highly recommend it!!! We bought two!!!
reviews.title: Worth the money

reviews.text: I've owed this for 7 years. I love how easily and quickly it blows up and it also deflates the same way! I have dragged my two medium sized dogs in and out of this this many times. They jump all over it and it has never even leaked one time. It has held up great. I love the convenience of this and it already fits back into the bag.
reviews.title: Great inflatable kayak

reviews.text: The Fiji Kayak is great except for the following: (1) the permanent seat is not comfortable at all. It lacks back support. However, the removable seat is very comfy. (2) It wobbles too much as a single rider kayak. Best to use as a two person kayak.
reviews.title: Could be better

reviews.text: Bought this to take camping with us. Ok for the kids, awkward with two adults. Seatback is not supported, so rear person is almost laying down when paddling. Unusable for me. Bought a small sit on to use instead. For two normal sized adults this is more a floatie.
reviews.title: Floatie kayak

reviews.text: it doesn't hold air. it's pain to fill because the port doesn't block when you pull the pump out do it deflates. also, missing the paddle
reviews.title: TERRIBLE!

reviews.text: Two person kayak with paddle fo $120, great value, but the majority of the air chambers didn't inflate. The ones that did inflate, would deflate after putting pressure on them. Returned, and paid $50 more for standard kayak.
reviews.title: Inflatable Raft that doesn't inflate

reviews.text: Material too thin. By the time you try to close the plugs the air is half out.I took it back. Very disappointed. I looked a long time for one I could afford,sad to say it did not work out.

Took it out for the first time and paddles a couple of miles on some smooth and some choppy water. I think it tracks as well as some lower and mid grade sit ons and sit ins that I've tried. Got to admit that the water slapping on the hull unnerved me a little when I realized I was a mile out in an inflatable but it was very sturdy and stable. I'm 5'8" 175 lbs and there was plenty of room. If you're much taller though you may have to not use the inflatable hull insert to give you more leg room. Easy and quick to inflate. The paddle could be a little more solid on the ends but it worked fine. I also found that you can keep your legs out like a sit on top or sit in so that was nice. Overall great buy.
reviews.title: Can't beat it for the price

reviews.text: Great little kayaks, I bought 2 as they were on sale. I find them fairly stable not tippy and easy to set up. They get blown around in the wind a bit but overall its a great way to paddle around the lake. We have used them with adults as well as children and everyone loves them. Glad I purchased the second, if they were still on sale i'd buy two more.
reviews.title: Very Happy

reviews.text:
Great little kayak for calm waters, just not for rapids.
Nowhere near as fast as a solid one, but it gets you offshore.
Do not venture into waters you're not certain you can paddle your way back.
reviews.title: Great little kayak.

reviews.text: I'm glad we found these - it was something we wanted to try, but lack storage, so the inflatable Kayaks fit the bill!
reviews.title: Super easy & fun!

reviews.text: This thing is awesome, light weight, strong and well worth the money
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.text: Love the ease of inflating and deflating this little kayak. The portability is great. Everything fits into the carrying bag. I was expecting a cheap little oar to be included and was happily surprised with the collapse-able oar that comes with it. I've used the kayak in God's Lake Narrows MB and creeks and ponds in Southern ON. I plan to buy another.
reviews.title: Great value for your money

reviews.text: I bought this kayak 2 weeks ago and have since tried it on a 3 hour river trip. It worked great and was easy to blow up at the beginning of the trip. Paddling is smooth and I am very impressed with the quality.
reviews.title: Excellent for the river!

reviews.text: I bought this kayak so it would fit in my car for some sunrise or sunset kayaking on the lake. I am 5 ‘7” and I feel if would be anstufggle for anyone taller put their legs inside the kayak.  The seat is a little high but next time I plan on only filling it slightly. I love that is dries easily and the bag is big enough to put it back into after folding it.  It does exactly what I needed it to do. It's not a long distance kayak but it is a great yak for casual relaxing!
reviews.title: Great over all

reviews.text: Bought them, opened the box and returned them. Outer shelf felt to weak for rough water.We were worried damage would occur on rough beaches or hidden branches on a river. Great value for sandy beach area.
reviews.title: Not rough water

reviews.text:
I have owned the K2 before and found it to be a very good kayak. Returned it do to a failed Boston valve.

I purchased it's little brother the K1 so I could keep it my trunk at all times so I'd be ready whenever.

I am about 6'1" and 195lbs. I DO NOT recommend this kayak for anyone of this body type.

Issues:
1. The kayak has too much yaw. You will not track straight even though you have a skeg on the bottom. Your energy will go into zig-zaging and it's very tiring to actually cover much area.

2. You must insert your legs straight and flat into the nose of the kayak or you bump into your knees as you paddle. After two hours I was very sore not being able to move my legs as they are wedged into the nose.

3. In two hours I almost tipped over three times. I was in flat, calm water with no wind. It was very frustrating how tippy this boat feels. You can't look back over your shoulder (no exaggeration) without the kayak starting to roll.

All of these Negatives are NOT an issue if you of a smaller body type and are playing around in a pond or for kids vs. wanting to actually go in a straight line and kayak.

I recommend the K2 instead as it's a five star. Both K1 & K2 are of excellent construction.

My K1 was returned. Hope someone finds this helpful.
reviews.title: Not for anyone over 6 feet tall.

reviews.text: great kayak, easy to blow up and easy while on the water. I have used mine a number of times and have had no problems.
reviews.title: excellent kayak

reviews.text:
My Husband and I have rented Kayaks for playing in local Ponds and Lakes, but the Hard Shell type are so heavy and we would have to buy a Trailer to haul them around,  so when we saw this Inflatable one on line we decided to try it out.
Easy to inflate, and not too heavy for us to move around, Nice Canvas type covering, nicely made, roomy, and fun. We bought the 3 man in case one of the Grandkids wanted to come along, so glad we did, having the leg room is nice for just 2 people.
reviews.title: Love It!

reviews.text:
well made, well thought out, 
fits 2 adults plus child or dog, 
fits 4 children w supervision, 
might be tight for 3 adults, 
capacity is 420 lbs,  very stable, 
have not tried to deflate and put back into the carry bag yet
the bundled paddle for $32 is a great buy too
good service at WalMart.com  A+
reviews.title: great !!

reviews.text:
The Sevylor Inflatable Kayak is great! First off, its really compact when deflated, making it super easy to store, but is huge once its inflated. I was skeptical of its size when I saw it deflated because it was pretty small folded up, but wow it was massive when inflated. Its made from a very durable material and has multiple air chambers so it wont deflate if it is punctured. This is absolutely perfect for weekend trips outside of the city or to bring up to mountain lakes and rivers without having to strap a huge kayak to the roof. 

I wrote this unbiased review as part of a contest.
reviews.title: Awesome inflatable kayak

reviews.text:
Ever run into the problem of having way too many people, and not enough space in the kayak? Well, the Sevylor Big Basin 3-Person Inflatable Kayak solves that problem! It is the perfect kayak to solve your large group needs. Take turns of 3 and everyone gets a ride or get two and get 6 people out on the water at a time. Or bring your dog on board or throw a cooler in the back. The possibilities are seriously endless. 

Aside from all the functionality, this kayak also stacks up when it comes to its quality, build, and design. It feels tough and strong, has a great architecture, and looks cool on the water. It is super buoyant and I have never had it capsize on me. Overall this is just a great kayak for both lake use and faster rivers!

I wrote this review as part of a contest.
reviews.title: Great Kayak for Big Groups!

reviews.text:
have you ever had those moments that are just so simple and pure? just so beautiful that you never want them to end? just so calm and collected that you begin to question if you even are in reality?
that is how i felt when i was sitting in this kayak. it was truly amazing. properly inflated on all around. was literally floating on air.
then the current picked up and i felt totally safe and secure. i knew that whatever happened, i would be ok in this lovely kayak.
then the time came to leave, so i deflated the kayak on shore and easily packed it up and threw it in my car. 
now every time i see a lake, i no longer have to think "what a beautiful body of water, i wish i could kayak that." i simply take my kayak out of my car, easily inflate it, and i am off.
what an amazing product. if you are reading this i only have one question, why have you not bought it yet?


I wrote this for a contest
reviews.title: Aquaman would approve

reviews.text:
My parents just bought kayaks for our cottage but were interest in finding a way for the whole family to join. We didn't have any more space in or on top of our car so we thought we'd have to give up on the idea. This product is a great solution. I wasn't sure how it would handle in rough water but after seeing it I would feel more than comfortable taking it fishing or rafting.

I wrote this review for a contest
reviews.title: Creative Way for the Whole Family to Join

reviews.text:
I was very impressed with this product. The quality is great and what I am very impressed with is how compact this product is when not inflated. It completely deflates and is able to fold into a bag (included) for easy storage and easy travel. I was impressed with how easy it was to set up. It only takes a few minutes to inflate and then you are all set to enjoy a great day on the lagoon. I also think that it is great that this product holds multiple people. I have a house on the lagoon and this product will allow my friends and I to enjoy a few fun times. I would recommend this purchase if you are in the market for a kayak (or even if your not..maybe you should be!). Affordable, compact, safe, stylish and great quality. 

I wrote this review for a contest.
reviews.title: Great Product, Compact and Safe!

reviews.text:
I like this kayak because the materials seem to be pretty strong,
easy to set up - although no instructions.

It tracks very well, speed is ok for inflatable, against wind is ok. - I give 90 points for these.

However, I found 2 air chambers squeeze my butt from both sides - very uncomfortable although I am not a big person.  The beam should be a little wider.

These seats do not inflate easily, and tend to loose air soon.  Blowing air into these seats from small air valves are very difficult.... inflate - close the lid - already loose a half the air.  Manufacturer needs to replace these cheap air valves. 

Carrying bag is also weak.  It tore and its eye led came off in the first use.
Totally I give 3 stars.  Do you, manufacturer, replace carrying bag and seats?
reviews.title: nice materials, narrow beam

reviews.text:
I got the kayak because i wanted a 3 person kayak the was also portable.  Just FYI it does not come with pump or paddles. The kayak is built well. It inflated to a semi ridged. I paddles very well, is very stable. The seats were not to my liking but that is personal you may be ok with them.

Now the huge flaw for me is that the tubes are covered in a cloth material. when it gets wet it does add more wieght to kayak so picing it up is harder, also the biggset issue is there is no way to dry the tubes unless you leave it out in sun blown up for how ever long it takes. but if you roll it up before it drys you may have a mold issue. 

I ended up returning it and buying the sea eagle 370. the sea eagle is a fantastic boat.
reviews.title: Good but has design flaw

reviews.text: We bought this two years ago and loved it initially.  However, one pontoon develped constant seam leaks and one of the valves became defective.  I have searched and searched for the correct valve and I can not find it.  Sevylor has NO customer support.  There is no one to call or write with issues and they do not sell replacement parts.
reviews.title: The Kayak would be fine if Sevylor cared

reviews.text:
This Sevylor Big Basin 3-Person Inflatable Kayak was exactly what I was looking for! This is very easily portable and easy to inflate; it is compact enough to store at home without taking up too much space. This kayak fits three people comfortably (and even more so if you only have two passengers) and I was surprised by how high quality the material felt for the price. It felt surprisingly stable for an inflatable kayak. For the price, you can't beat this deal.

I wrote this review for a contest.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text:
This kayak is great for casual trips and also for enthusiasts doing more serious excursions. It's very portable when uninflated and easy to blow up. The construction is super durable and it feels very professional. It's comfortable for multiple people to be in it at the same time. Overall I would definitely recommend this to beginners and experts alike.

I wrote this review as part of a contest.
reviews.title: Comfortable for all users

reviews.text: This Kayak is great!! Because it is inflatable, it is super easy to stick it in the car and drive to the bay on a moments notice. It fits three people, so it is perfect for my family, and allows us to spend quality time on the water without too much planning. It has to be inflated, which is pretty painless, but then it is water ready and leads to hours of fun! It seems sturdy and has worked well for both kids and adults. Overall I really love this convenient, easy to use Kayak, and I love the extra family fun it has provided!
reviews.title: The perfect Kayak for a family outing!!

reviews.text:
I was introduced to kayaking on a calm water several years ago and liked it a lot. Up until recently it was only a rental and a part of some “touristy” activity. The idea of owning one was scared to me: where would I store it while not in use? How I am going to transfer it to the water? I don't want to buy a trailer just for that activity. 
I never thought about Inflatable Kayak until now. With this one all my issues are addressed. Stored it just another large duffle bag and can easy fit in a trunk. Inflating it – just a simple task and I don't have to worry about trailer, parking for it and so on. It's semi-ragged once inflated so no issue here. And it's inexpensive enough not to worry about buying it and not using it enough (like some other sport equipment, happens to all of us :) ) . And if I feel that I am using it a lot and there is some deficiency with it I can always upgrade to the better one.
I wrote this review for a contest but my opinion about the item is completely unbiased.
reviews.title: Easy and painless entry into the kayaking.

reviews.text: This is a fantastic kayak! Since it is an inflatable kayak, it is extremely easy to transport wherever you want to take it and even comes with a bag to carry it around in. Once inflated, the kayak feels extremely sturdy and durable. I loved that you could fit three people in it to take it out for a day on the water. The only thing that I would note about this kayak is that you need to provide your own pump. I wrote this review for a contest.

For the price it's a very nice Kayak. Not disappointed at all. Does not come with paddles or pump, but the price reflects that. Easy to set up and take down. The storage bag is a little too small (hard to get back in bag and no room to store pump).

This Kayak is a a nicely styled, very well built product. For three large men, it seemed like a bit of a tight fit, but it certainly fits three people. 

I wrote this review for a contest.
reviews.title: Very Sturdy, tight fit

reviews.text: This kayak is great. Paddles well and two adults and two dogs works well. You need a special adaptor for one valve which should be part of boat but can be ordered

Great Kayak for 3. Surprisingly fitting it back into the travel bag was a breeze, which is a big plus! 

I wrote this review for a contest.
reviews.title: Great Kayak for 3

reviews.text: very durable, has not tipped over, good for two adults plus one child or dog,
reviews.title: great kayak,

reviews.text: There are numerous amenities to the Payette Angler Kayak. It's lightweight and easy to carry, especially with the hand grips just inside the opening. The opening is wide which makes it easier to get in and out and provides more room for accessing my tackle box. The low profile makes it easier for me to row without scraping my knuckles. The pole holders are a great convenience.
reviews.title: Great Fishing Kayak!

reviews.text: In looking for a quality kayak to enjoy the local rivers and lakes, this manufacturer was highly recommended for quality, pricing, weight and durability. Their Customer Service was highlighted as among the very best anywhere. I found it easy to manage in transport, carrying, launching and recovery. Agility and true line of travel were commensurate with the skills of the person using the kayak. Comfortable with adjustable seat and foot pegs. Drain plug easy to use and kayak light enough to tilt upright for drainage even with water in the craft from rapids of cast off from using the paddles. Fun experience and extremely satisfied with products. When you have a great product at a great price and manufacturer customer service, you just have to take time to do a review of your own experience. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
reviews.title: Lifetime Payette Angler

reviews.text: Out of 5 different Kayaks for my family, this is my favorite one.

Love the fact that it has a drain plug in the front on top for draining any extra water out.
two rod holders behind seat and one in front. The one in front is perfect. best bang for the buck. light, roomy, durable.
reviews.title: great fishing Kayak

reviews.text:
Lifetime decided not to continue selling spray skirts for this kayak, and only lists Length and Width.  Obviously, the circumference was missing.  Customer service transferred me to one of their kayak specialist, Caleb, who was nothing short of "GREAT".  His database did not have the info, so we went into the warehouse to find this exact Kayak, but to no avail. 

So I asked how can we think outside the box to achieve our goal, and he suggested talking to one of the engineers while I waited on the phone.  Within two minutes, he came back with the answer, 109.5".  He told me the engineer checked via a design program, and bingo!  

My only complaint is that this info was not listed within their specifications, and hopefully will be confirmed and listed within the day.  

I would have given it four stars, but Caleb went beyond the call of duty, hence the five stars.  Once I find a spray skirt that will fit a 109.5" opening, I will buy it immediately!
...and I'm not one to write reviews, but when someone shines so bright, I just had to let their customers and company know.  Cheers!
reviews.title: Fantastic Customer Service!

reviews.text: Easy to carry, comfortable, plenty of room inside to store fishing gear. Love the color. Very easy to clean, it has a drain plug so you can let the water out of it after you clean it.
reviews.title: Great Kayak for the money

reviews.text:
We bought two sit-on-top Lotus kayaks last summer, and my husband really wanted a sit-in kayak.  So this year we bought the Payette to add to our fleet.  Of course, my only request to him was that it was a LIFETIME kayak.  LOVE their products! 
This is the perfect size, paddles great on lakes and ponds, very smooth ride and easy steering.  He is 6'2" and has plenty of leg room.  We decided on a fishing model in case our young boys want that option some day.  Back rest is well made and higher than most other brands; more comfortable!  The slim (not so deep) design makes it more realistic for transport, and the weight is moderately easy to carry.  My only wish is that it would have come with a paddle like our other Lifetime kayaks did.  All in all, we are so happy (and proud) of our Lifetime products! :) [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
reviews.title: LOVE my LIFETIME kayaks!

reviews.text: This is the worse kayak ever I bought 2 n me n my wife kayak all the time n wanted to try these n they totally are trash my wife stopped paddling n the kayak never stays straight it always turns to right or left n we thought it was the weight so I tried mine n the same I highly recommend nobody to buy them
reviews.title: Very bad kayaks

reviews.text: I ordered this item June 20th, didn't get it until July 10th, 10 days after its scheduled arrival! Upon being freighted through 2 different companies, it was lost, then 2 days later recovered, and then the whole order was cancelled! After being on the phone with Walmart and pilot freight for a week straight trying to get this mess figured out it was finally somewhat resolved. When I got my kayak it was scratched up, black dust covered it from top to bottom, there were missing pieces, broken pieces, and random pieces that didn't even belong with the kayak! I called Walmart they said nothing they could do other then return it and send me something else and that LAST thing I was going to do was wait another 3-4 weeks for a replacement! Luckily lifetime actually STANDS BEHIND their products and is sending me replacement pieces! I will NEVER EVER order from Walmart again, not big freight anyways...I suggest no else either!! I can't get the pictures to upload but the kayak was a mess when it was received!!
reviews.title: Worst online experience ever!!!!

reviews.text:
This is my first kayak and I am in love with it!  It's great.  Has three fishing pole holders (two in the back and one up front).  There is also dry storage in the back.  It's not real deep and doesn't appear to be watertight, but would be great for use as a cooler.  This is a great, inexpensive kayak for a beginner!

All of that being said, ordering through Walmart went exactly as I expected.  First, my kayak arrived a week later than the expected date.  No big deal.  Just meant I wasn't going to be paddling for another week.  What really made me upset was when I saw how my kayak was handled.  It had a huge gash taken out of the side of it and the entire front portion was scratched and marked up with pretty deep gouges.  But as I was saying.. I had anticipated this.

This is a great kayak.  Please buy it if you're looking to get into kayaking or want an inexpensive one.  Just be aware of ordering it from Walmart.
reviews.title: What I expected from Walmart

reviews.text:
Have canoed for years but thought a kayak would be nice to fish out of. Bought the Lifetime Payette Angler Fishing kayak and I LOVE it ! It tracks straight and is very stable. Comes with a lot of nice features: Rod holder on dash, paddle holder, two rod holders on rear dash, carry handles at each end, cup holder, removable back rest, drain plug, flotation foam in the stern. I like the multiple stationary foot rest as I like to move my feet around and not have to readjust every time.  I was glad it did not come with a paddle as I already had one picked out and didn't want an extra laying around.   

 The kayak was a floor model in the store and was missing a couple parts. I called customer service to order the parts and they were very nice and professional. I received the parts in a couple days and am enjoying my new kayak very much.

Lifetime, you have made me a very HAPPY customer! I will be buying my wife a Lifetime Tamarack sit-on and probably more for the grankids. I have told all my friends about my great experience and recommend lifetime products. To top it off, it is American Made!

Thanks
David T.
reviews.title: My First Kayak and AMAZING Customer Service!

reviews.text: I wanted to share the outstanding Customer Service I received from Luke and team. I had some minor issues with the Handles for carrying and beaching. They took care of my issue very quickly and had new parts in the mail!
reviews.title: Kayak Payette Angler

reviews.text: perfect for hobbyist.  lightweight and 5 yr warranty.

I purchased this product and had lower expectations due to the price. I was pleasantly surprised when the item arrived in two days. Set up was a breeze and only took about 10 minutes with a hand air pump. The boat is sturdy and easily and comfortably fit two adults. This is a great recreational toy and serves its purpose. I wouldn't recommend taking it in roaring rapids or extreme conditions, but a nice trip on the lake or a calm river is perfect for this kayak. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
reviews.title: Great Value!

reviews.text: Easy to follow directions. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
reviews.title: Would buy this again

reviews.text: absolutely love mine!! This is my 3rd summer using this kayak. it is very durable and easy to use. My cousin and I have had a blast!
reviews.title: Thumbs up!

reviews.text: Lightweight! Glides easily in the water. There is a removable skeg/fin that snaps in with no locking mechanism. I would think it would pop off if grounded, but it did not. Read items that are shipped as it does not come with a pump or bag, I have one from another kayak. You will need two nozzles to inflate. The main three plugs are NOT screw plugs and simply push in. Tough to release if your hands are wet. The top end sections to inflate are silly and only hold a bit of air. If the small air release tubes are still in plug from shipping, remove them immediately so the inner flap closes on its own. Do not store with those tubes inserted, but keep them handy for deflation. The seats stay secure with the adjustable buckles. Dog goes in and out with ease and nails do not puncture. The walls are high and seats low so it is more canoe than kayak when paddling. The oars have a lot more weight than expected and the connections unscrew during use. Bonus, there is a drain plug to release water when packing it up. Recommend blowing up and leaving for a day or two to determine if any leaks prior to arriving at the water. Mine did NOT have any issues or require special accommodations.
reviews.title: Great and inexpensive for summer outings!

reviews.text: It's a gift so unable to give complete review [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
reviews.title: Price was right & super fast shipping

reviews.text: Does not come with a pump. Nice and deep and sturdy. Hands got a little sore from paddling so gloves might be a good option. The paddles worked well and we would have stayed completely dry except for the water dripping off the paddles.  Use the first time with one adult and one child and the second time with two children aged 13 and 10 and they had no problems.
reviews.title: Good buy

reviews.text: That it was inflatable.
reviews.title: kayak

reviews.text:
No assembly directions- 2 pictures.
The kayak was spinning in circles even with the fin on the bottom.
The oars were too short for my preference.
The seats were very flimsy, you couldn't even lean back without them falling onto the person behind you's legs.

Fairly easy return process.
reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! WASTE OF MONEY!

reviews.text: Husband and I have gone out once.  Inflates and deflates quickly and handled nearly 400lbs of weight very nicely. Stable...no rocking. Havent had long enough to share more but much easier to transport than a hard kayak.

I was looking for a kayak that we could use occasionally when camping.  This kayak is surprisingly sturdy.  You must use the manual hand pump that is included to inflate the kayak, but it takes less than 10 minutes.  Definitely a good investment for our needs.
reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to inflate.

reviews.text: I use with my SailboatsToGo sail kit and it really flies!   It has just enough firmness and rigidity to make a good sailing craft -- much better than cheaper single-ply inflatables.   No, it's not the equal of a $900 inflatable kayak with drop-stitch high-pressure floor, but it's good enough for some really fun sailing.
reviews.title: Really Flies with my SailboatsToGo sail kit on it!

reviews.text: Excellent value (we shopped around online). Very easy and quick to inflate/deflate. The hand pump that came with it is extremely efficient and pumps air in on both up and down strokes. Feels nice and sturdy and secure out on the (alligator infested) Florida waterways. A great buy.
reviews.title: Excellent value, a fabulous boat for two.

reviews.text: Good quality. Used it over 20 times this summer. Totally worths the money!
reviews.title: Satisfied with my purchase!

reviews.text: Great kayak. It can be set up for one person or two.  I use it for both fishing and for paddling exercise.
reviews.title: Great kayak

reviews.text: The material is pretty thick and feels pretty sturdy.  Really like it, its heavier that what I thought but looks good quality.
reviews.title: Intex Vinyl Kayak

reviews.text: Very easy to inflate and get on the water. First time was just to test things out. Cant wait to see if I can get both dogs with me on the water...
reviews.title: No regrets.

reviews.text:
So this WAS a great purchase and very easy to set up.

Unfortunately, I used this only 2 times and now it leaks air from 1 of the 3 chambers. We were very cautious and cannot find a leak. I have asked for help by email and have been ignored. No response equals not a good review. I wish they would help me.
reviews.title: Unfrtunately not responsive to emails.

reviews.text: All I can say is that the kayak is great BUT!!!!!!!!! the PSI to make sure you don't over or under inflate does not work. I'm not at all happy about this.
We are so excited about our new inflatable kayak.  It is perfect for us and very sturdy and easy to use.
reviews.title: Excited for kayaking

reviews.text: Worth it! A bit expensive but totally worth it. Sturdy and very comfortable, easy to inflate, light weight as well. I have a lot of fun in this since buying it
reviews.title: Amazing experience

reviews.text: Had it for 2 months. Went out 2 times and flat. Took extra care and cautious.

This kayak is very poorly constructed. I have two. All of the seats (including one replacement) have begun to leak at the weld seams. The other Kayak has had multiple leaks in the main chamber(s). Intex puts you though hours of holding on the telephone, forms to fill out, photos to upload, stuff to send back. All because their product was defective, no fault of yours. They actually don't follow through with their warranty sometimes. You'll be on hold for hours, send emails that don't get responded to, and spend more time pulling your hair out than enjoying this Kayak. After being on hold for one hour (after sending 3 emails to them over the span of 5 months that weren't responded to), for a warranty claim I spent hours on, that they never fulfilled. I finally speak to someone and they say too bad, you are out of luck, you are outside the warranty window now. I will never buy an Intex product again after my experience with the company and product. Its just horrible.
reviews.title: Intex really sucks, so do their products.

reviews.text: Im delighted with my inflatable kayak. It is big enough for my husband and I   It is easy to set up and take down.  We can take it anywhere as it easily fits inside my SUV.
reviews.title: Staycation 2020!

reviews.text: Extra Nice Kayak for the money.  Inflates in couple minutes with  pump.  Didn't  want kayak that takes up room in  garage or shed. This one goes back in the bag and  in storage room in basement. Fun and easy with one or two people, Used it on small lakes, down river and even in my pool for fun... Thick construction. Might get another. .
reviews.title: Durable

reviews.text: I love this boat. Fairly easy to set up and take down, and handles beautifully in the water.  Everything fits into the bag no problem. I have a small (tiny) car and love the water. I live near numerous lakes and love to fish, so this kayak allows me to get on the water and fish inexpensively.
reviews.title: Splendid Solution

reviews.text: I appreciated the easy set up. I did not appreciate the first time using it that it started to deflate in the middle of the lake with my young child aboard. And had reached out to seller regarding this event days ago and have heard nothing back. Extremely upset with this product
reviews.title: Don't make the mistake of buying

reviews.text:
I bought this for family fun, we don't really go fishing. Its really heavy when inflated and deflated.  We took it out on the water twice, the first was me and my son. It seemed ok, not really the fastest. The second time it was me and my husband, 
and the boat was really slow. Unfortunately,  while we were on the water we noticed that the left tube started deflating. Luckily we were on our local lake, so we paddled back to shore and returned it the next day. Overall observations,  when riding single with the seat in the middle, it becomes very rocky. So I would say, unless u r a really big person or have a lot of gear, this is better as double. Also the inflatable seats are so uncomfortable and provide no support. Also the paddles are so short for the width of the boat.  For the price, it's a nice recreational kayak to have some fun with kids.
reviews.title: Ok quality for the price

reviews.text:
I bought this kayak when away from home to access some areas for fishing.  I used it a couple of times while away from home set up for a single fisherman.  

The material is like my larger rafts and appears to be tough enough for use on rivers.  It has the same kind of inflation points as my rafts and the pump works well.  

Inflation and set up was really quick and easy.  Probably less than 10 minutes to set up and be on the water.  Light weight and easy to carry down to the water.  

Deflation, takedown and folding up for putting in the supplied bag took about the same amount of time.

I was using this kayak on a still water lake.  On the water, this kayak worked very well.  I used the larger fin and tracking was great.  The paddle could be upgraded, but is sufficient and lightweight.  It does catch a little wind, but not bad and still controllable.  I did not use the rod holders.  There was adequate room for my gear and some water.

I travelled on an airplane back home.  The entire package in the bag with a life jacket was 37 pounds.  It was a bit bulky carrying into the airport but made it home with no issues.  I will likely travel with this to other destinations and on vacations.

Looking forward to using this around the lake near our house with the wife and grandkids.  Will probably use it on some of the local rivers as well.
reviews.title: Great value for an inflatable kayak!

reviews.text:
Felt more like sitting in a blowup life raft than a kayak. Used it once. I believe that had a slow leak. Felt more like sitting in a blowup life raft then a kayak. No tracking, difficult to paddle. Used it once. I believe it had a slow leak. Couldnt get it blown up enough to enjoy.Sent it back, waiting for a refund .
This would be a fun boat for letting the children paddle around the pond in. Definitely not for an adult who intends to use it to kayak.
reviews.title: Disappointed/sent it back for a refund.

reviews.text: Easy to use and sturdy.  The included air pump filled the kayak in about 3 minutes!  Dried it and folded it up easily for to store away.
reviews.title: Sets up quickly, light and easy to use.

reviews.text: Easy setup.  Each time is a great experience.   My grandsons and I love this kayak.
reviews.title: Kayaking

reviews.text: So easy to blow up and the kids loved it.
We love these have inly used them twice but super simple set up always air bottom first . it deff holds up well i put my 10 year old 8 year old and myself in one and it was perfect .
reviews.title: Love them

reviews.text:
We bought this kayak when we were considering renting one on the St Joseph Penninsula. Not only was it cheaper but we got to keep it!
Pros:
cheap
light (in comparison- its about 35-40 lbs)
sturdy
heavy duty
easy to inflate and 'assemble' (minimal)
Cons:
the seats provide virtually no support to the person in front

That's about it. We had a blast in it and hope to take it out in the Chicago river or Lake Michigan this summer.
reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to inflate.

reviews.text: After biking most of the summer, my husband and I decided that we needed an upper body workout so we purchased the Intex Challenger K2. We did find this product at another vendor but chose to purchase it through Walmart because the list price was much less. Although we've only been out on it once, we found it stable and enjoyable. It didn't take much time to inflate (the process adds to the workout) and it deflates easily. When deflated it is compact, all parts fit well in the carry bag and we didn't have to secure it to the roof of the car to transport! We are looking forward to using it again.
reviews.title: great value for a novice!

reviews.text: Overall it seems to be a good value.  We are first time kayak owners.  Being able to deflate it and stow it in the back of the car is much easier for us than carrying on the roof.  Inflation and assembly were pretty quick and easy,  It was stable and did well our first time on the water with it.  Let see how well it travels with us to quiet waters across the country over the next few months.
reviews.title: Easy to use and worth the price so far.

reviews.text: First off, I know the customer service for Intex is spotty due to past experiences with them. Calling customer service took me to someone in China who was not very familiar with the product I had and was not very helpful. We had bought an Explorer kayak that had the plastic paddle shaft connector grip break on the first stroke on one of the paddles and the only solution given was to return it to Walmart which seemed ridiculous since it was a $5 replacement part that has been "out of stock" on their website for months. I bought this knowing it is from Walmart and I can at least take it back there if something happens. That being said, the kayak matches up to other inflatables I have used and has the same issues such as blowing in the wind and not tracking perfectly. However, this is expected with ALL other inflatable kayaks I have used and this one is durable and holds up nicely. My skeg has NOT fallen out and it seems to stay in place very nicely and securely. The oars for this are curved and much better than the ones that come with the Explorer - they don't have the cheap plastic paddle shaft connectors that broke on the other one. I have used this for fishing and it has more than adequate room for myself and equipment when used alone. With two passengers, it still has more room than the other Sevylor Tahiti I have used in the past which is very tight. All in all the package is a steal for all of the things you get in it. You may want to order another bigger mesh bag and upgrade a paddle possibly but the value of the bundle is nice.
reviews.title: Great inflatable kayak

reviews.text: I bought the K2 Challenger on a lark after reading the reviews online. It says a two person Kayak but would be better for one adult and one child. We decided to tape the skeg on after reading that a lot of people lost theirs on the first time and was glad we did because it would have been gone if we hadn't. Overall we had a great time in it and would recommend it to anyone. We have never Kayaked before and found it to be really stable and easy to maneuver. It was really easy to blow up with the foot pump, a lot easier than I expected. The paddles although were kind of on the cheap side but gave us no problems at all. We did blow it up on a cool morning in the shade for the first time and it deflates fairly quickly when done. Thought we would have to add air to it but it stayed inflated for three days without having to add air. Over all I am glad we made the purchase.
reviews.title: Overall good but too small for 2 adults

reviews.text:
Pros:
It is nice and good looking.
It is easy to move. Compactness is good.

Cons:
The material quality is cheaper than its price.
The pump was like broken. The cover was torn when I opened it at the first time. (Picture attached)
The seats are like nothing. You cannot lean on them at all.
Its width is too short. I am not sure if keeping it balanced on the water would be an easy job.

Be aware of the return policies of this seller. Although the seller does not provide the return shipping costs (which is too much because it is heavy), I am going to return it.
reviews.title: I am going to return it.

reviews.text: This was a great deal, and I'm happy with the kayak.  The first one would not hold air in the bottom chamber, but Windycity Superstore promptly sent me a replacement hull.  So far, so good.  The hand pump  is a bit of a pain in the back when filling the boat with air, but doable.  The only drawback is that it is very hard to drain the water out of after using.  Also another bit of advice, the back seat is much more comfortable because the back rests up against the back of the kayak.  I make my daughter, who is smaller and younger anyway, sit up front.  I have taken this out by myself, and it works great for 1 person, too.
reviews.title: Great deal

reviews.text: I own a hard body kayak, but it is very heavy. I wanted something light weight that would be easy to transport and use on a local lake. This is a great kayak for that. It inflates very quickly with the hand pump. My other kayak has a pretty flat hull, so it is very stable. This kayak seems less stable. This kayak also does not seem to track as well as my hard body one. There are some trade-offs with an inflatable, but I was very pleased with this boat's performance as a lake kayak.
reviews.title: Great kayak for the price!

reviews.text: The first thing to know is that the reviews out there are not all for the same model/year of this kayak. I am reviewing a green/gray, two seat, single rear skeg, kayak bought in 2014. This boat is well worth the $120.00 I paid for it. The skeg WILL sometimes come off if you hit bottom when you are launching or landing and you DO need it! I drilled a small hole in it and tied a loose line from it to the boat--not too taunt or you can't get the skeg out when you WANT it out. This worked great for peace of mind. The boat is amazingly stable, quiet, and moves through the water better than I hoped--and it fits in the trunk of my compact car!
reviews.title: Very good product--find a way to attach the skeg!

reviews.text: This kayak arrived within a few days.  All parts were included. oars assemble easily and work well. The skeg secures in seconds and does not come out easily.  The kayak inflates in 5-8 minutes with the included pump.  The material is thick but certainly not puncture proof.  proper care is needed.  I've inflated and deflated this kayak three times over the last three weeks and it's been a pleasure to use so far. I use it solo, and it's probably nice for two people under 6 foot.  For 2 people over 6' its going to be a little more of a cramped fit.  It's a good deal so far, we'll see how long the seams hold up to extended use.
reviews.title: so far so good

reviews.text: We bought these Kayaks for our camping trip to Lake City Colorado. We were camping on lake San Crystobal and really wanted kayaks. However we needed two doubles and they were so expensive and many came without paddles. These Kayaks are so easy to blow up and they were excellent quality. They came with the pump, two paddles, a bag to place every thing in when you were done, easy to paddle across the lake,they were easy to deflate and the seats were adjustable and comfortable. We were all so completely happy with this product. Can not wait to use them on the lake by our home.

reviews.text: This is a very popular first craft for people, everywhere I take it I see people that have the same one. And on YouTube this is what they recommend. You can inflate it in less than 10 minutes.
reviews.title: The perfect first kayak

reviews.text:
These packable kayaks will be perfect for us to throw in the car with our camping gear and head out to the lake. 

Inflation is quick and easy, under 10 minutes. The pump is very efficient. Deflation and packing up takes under 15 minutes. 

The kayak tracks much better than I expected, even with a 15 mph wind raising small waves on the lake.  It feels reasonably stable. The included paddle is also better than expected.

The float/footrest doesn't work as a footrest for me and my legs feel cramped when extended in the cockpit. I bend my knees a bit and bract my heels against each other. This raises my center of gravity a bit, but doesn't make me feel like I'm about to capsize.  Sometimes I put my legs on top of the cockpit.

While on the water, I stash the bag with pump behind the seat. A gallon ziplock bag of snacks fits under the cargo net.

I would not take this kayak where sharp rocks or branches might be submerged. Although heavy gauge, it is vinyl and could puncture or rip. For a lazy afternoon at the lake, it's perfect.  And if we want to take a hike, we can pack it and stow it in the trunk of our car. No worrying about thieves at the trailhead. 

These won't replace our hard shell kayaks, but they will allow us to get on the water even if we  have to pack light.

We tried two other inflatable kayaks before finding these. One was very durable, but as heavy and bulky as our hard kayaks. The other was a glorified pool toy. Both cost a lot more than the Challenger K1. Neither made it out of our living room and both went back to the store. I think we're set for summer fun now.
reviews.title: Surprisingly good!

reviews.text: So easy to set up and so easy to use on the lake. Had so much fun. Only thing is that the instructions are not that great but I used YouTube to figure it out and once I got out there it was easy to figure it out. Still gave it 5 stars. My nephew now wants one.
reviews.title: So easy and so much fun!!

reviews.text: i bought this early last summer 2020 and have used it a good chunk of times since in lakes, rivers, canals, inlets... and its done great in all of them! make sure to put the little bottom fin on, I forgot the first time and was sliding around a bit. I've recommended this to literally anyone who will listen. I typically will inflate it a little ahead of time if i know I'm going to be taking it out and it makes it a 3-5 minute (maybe) process until I'm in the water. Fully inflating and getting in the water cant take more than 10min at the MOST.  this is really the perfect little adventure gear to have packed in your car where you can pop it out anytime you want! I've had no problems with holes or any other issues. make sure to be conscious of shallow water though as this is inflated it wont be able to take a drag over some sticks and rocks like a normal one would. over all thrilled with the purchase, great bang for your buck!
reviews.title: Great value for the price, very happy with my buy!

reviews.text: I have two of these and have used them over two dozen times in the last 9 months all over the country. Super easy to store in my car or my RV. I purchased an electric pump and car adapter, and it takes me about ten minutes to get on the water! Comfortable, relaxing, life-giving!
reviews.title: On the water in 10!

reviews.text: We bought this for our daughter for her birthday. She just turned 7 and we tried it out today. Works great! She seemed to enjoy it. She's still getting the hang of things, but I tried it out myself and it seems very stable and sturdy. (Felt like I was zooming across the lake compared to our Challenger 2. ha ha) This is a great value for the price and having everything included. I highly recommend it for those wanting to save some money and give kayaking a try!
reviews.title: Great Beginner Kayak

reviews.text:
Exceeded expectations in 
build quality and carrying capacity. It handled me and my gear (which exceeds the 220 lb. weight rating by 50 lb.) easily and respectably.  The included pump inflates both air chambers in less than 10 minutes total, while taking it easy. The included paddle is of decent quality and works well. I will be adding some mods to make it even more capable. Overall, you won't find a better 'bag-a-yak' than any of the Intex models for under $100!
reviews.title: Incredible Bag-a-Yak

reviews.text: We truly enjoy the inflatability, therefore transportability of this kayak! It seems to be holding up well as the vinyl is quick thick. The pump, which looks cheap, is actually really efficient. We plan to have many more outings this summer!
reviews.title: Great kayak for the money

reviews.text: Loved it...until a seam popped open on the inside of the stem after only 7 uses. I inflated it to manufacturers specifications each time, and I'm well under the weight limit.

I bought 3 Intex K1's and 2 K2's.  We used the K1's probably 10 times, if even that.  All three have leaks, 2 of which have a leak in the exact same place (they are side by side in the picture).  The 3rd I can't even get to because it is inside at the front.  If I pour in water, I can hear and see it bubble but it is in a seam so far in I can't reach it.  I sent a message to the company and this was their response:  
"Unfortunately, if the leak is located on a seam it will not be repairable since the seams are heat-sealed at a high temperature. We are truly sorry about what you have been through with one of our products and hope this unfortunate situation does not discourage you from choosing Intex in the near future."
Are you kidding me?  Of course it will discourage me from choosing Intex in the future.  They are unrepairable!  
As for the K2's, we have only used them a couple times so I'm not sure if they will hold up.

My big fancy kayak cracked and had to get something new. Only I hate wrestling a 70 lb kayak off the storage rack SO I decided to try something simpler. Have to say I was skeptical and in the end clicked check out with one eye closed.  
I use this kayak in a lake only, and only when water is calm. have NOT tried in any other setting
paddle: easy assembly
inflating: quick and easy, ready to ride in 10 minutes. hand pump is surprisingly easy and quick.
Rudder: easy on and off
Ride:  smooth, steers easy. Of course not the same glide as one made of hard material but but very good  all the same.
Seat: decent for being inflated. clips are helpful
Disassembly: easier if you have 20 minutes to kill to let deflate on its own Less squishing and smashing to get air out.
Carrying case: Fantastic! no critters get inside!
storage space required, minimal.
Overall a great buy for the money. completely satisfied! Even bought a second so my grandaughter and I can kayak together.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.text: These two make 5 of this Kayak I have purchased.  2020 I looked up in the Canadian sports reports which inflatable Kayak was the best and they listed K1 Inflatable Kayak.  I ordered three who went to my family down in Utah -- and last  year they loved them.  So I ordered two more for me and my daughter (58
reviews.title: Great Buy

reviews.text: I got this last spring.  For a first kayak, it is great.  I am 5'6" and do not have any problem with having enough leg-room (as some others have complained).   I really like that I can handle this all by myself, weights about 20 lbs.  Inflation is easy.  Very stable in the water and easy to get back into if you jump/fall out into the water.  However, it is slower than a regular hard shell kayak.  When I go by myself, I take this one because I can handle it alone and I don't mind if it's a little slow.   If I go with friends, I take my hard shell kayak instead because it's faster and I have help getting it off the car.   Seat in the Intex is very comfortable and I actually use this seat in my other kayak.  Package includes seat, inflater pump, and a paddle.  Just bring a towel to clean/dry the boat.  I also keep a large tarp (about 9 foot) in the car - very useful - I inflate and deflate this kayak on top of the tarp to protect it from the ground.  I sometimes need to use a small inflatable back pillow for extra back support.  Also, make sure you fully close the inflation holes on the seat after you fill it because they can leak otherwise.   A nice beginner kayak, easy for one person to handle, comfy seat, lightweight.  Just not real fast.
reviews.title: Nice beginner kayak for one person to handle alone

reviews.text: High quality (no production caused leaks) rapidly shipped. Inflated and on the water in 15 minutes or less.  Kayak works smooothly. Bonus: Caught lots of bass!
reviews.title: Great kayak...works perfectly!

reviews.text: Intex set this up to be a Kayak for the serious outdoorsman/woman.  Totally comfortable, stable, and in control when seated.  The maneuverability with the paddles are sure and the pump is powerful and fills the Kayak quickly.  This is a can't miss item for those that are risk takers on the water, and for the outdoor nature lover.
reviews.title: This is the Kayak of the Year!!!!

reviews.text:
This is a great kayak. But, just be sure that you are on smooth (lake-like) water. If you are in whitewater, you will be in trouble. Unlike a more expensive kayak, this will tip you over and try to float away from you. So, quite water is best for this kayak.

It fits great in my 4-door sedan and I can carry it pretty easily in the case it comes with. The paddles are easy to put together and total time from car to water ready is about 15 min. The included pump makes inflating the boat very fast and easy.
reviews.title: What I wanted and needed

reviews.text: Absolutely loved this kayak. Bought it for some summer fun. Took it on a camping trip on the lake and everyone with me used it many times. It was easy to inflate.
