reviews.text: If you're looking for a fishing kayak look no further .  This budget priced Kayak can hang with the highest of  Quality fishing kayaks !!  Super stable and everything I hoped it would be and more !!!  Couldn't be happier !!!
reviews.title: Absolutely awesome angling kayak !!!

reviews.text:
Awesome Kayak! Delivered within a week
Came with the Paddle and a flag as described!
One thing it will need is a rooe attached to pull it but thats easy!!!
Perfect size and delivered early!
The kayak is good but it says it come with kayak accessories. We were pretty sad when we went to take it out for first time and it didn't have a paddle
reviews.title: No paddle

reviews.text: Haven't tried it out yet, but did order a 2nd one once I saw it.  I'm sure my grandchildren will love it this summer.  Only problem was that the paddle was missing a part to join the two ends together.  Not a big deal since I already ordered a better paddle.
reviews.title: Kids Kyak

reviews.text: My son loves this kayak! He was out on the lake with it all day yesterday. Only complaint he had, the paddle is not great. I switched him for my paddle and he was correct. Other than the paddle, the kayak has a great base to help with not rolling easy.
reviews.title: Pandemic summer fun.

reviews.text: This is a good youth kayak, there are a couple things I wish this package had for the price but overall a great boat. My son is 6 years old and stands 4 ft tall; his feet do not reach the closest set of foot holds. There are two footholds 4 inches and 8 inches passed his reach. Which is great as he will grow into it but disappointing as it doesn't accommodate younger riders ready to learn. In calm waters its not a huge deterrent but more challenging when a stronger paddle is needed. I would like to see some straps in the cargo area as well. Even with these shortcomings I would recommend this kayak as a good starter for younger riders.
reviews.title: Very good youth kayak with some flaws.

reviews.text: Very disappointed that the kayak doesn't co.e with a paddle.  I have purchased 5 Lifetime kayaks (almost identical to this one) for half the price and included the paddle. I am now looking at paying an additional $40-50 for a paddle making this a $200 kayak.  Ridiculous!!! I'm glad I opened the plastic before taking it to the lake for the grandkids to play with. A cheap orange flag is not considered "accessories" . The kayak is great for kids but I would purchase the Lifetime brand for half the price and paddle included.
reviews.title: Accessories...lol

reviews.text:
I ordered 2 of these online and was appaled whenn I  received them! They say “with Ksyak Accessories,” and the photo shows they being pulled by a handle, however they came with NOTHING...no paddle, no handle to pull them with...only a brakeable plastic flag that won't even stay on the kayak! 
I purchased them for my twin grandsons' birthday, and I couldn't have been more disappointed when they opened them up. 
Plus, I have found the exact kayak available other places for half the price! Will definitely be asking for a refund or return. Sad.
This item does not bring the paddle.

Extremelly disappointed. Ordered 2. They came fast but missing parts!! The blue kayak has no paddle (so it's useless) and the yellow kayak came with an unmounted paddle missing one of the sides of the blue pole. Could not test the performance in water without paddles. Will return
reviews.title: Disappointed missing parts

reviews.text: I received it today, bought 2 for my kids for a camping trip.  neither came with a paddle.
reviews.title: paddle not included

reviews.text:
Not only I have first time user of kayaks, also I am handicapped and have a lot of trouble using my legs. This kayak was easy for me to get in and out of even though I am disabled, so if I can do it anyone can get in and out of it. From there the rest is easy as pie.. I was even able to put the kayak together all by myself, there aren't many steps in doing that and the pump that comes with the kayak is very adequate and quick for getting the boat ready. Several other people at the lake had the same boat, it is very popular. I love that it has a netted storage bin on the top front of the kayak so that I can bring along my drinks and other things as well.

Deflating the boat was a breeze with the easy valves they have on the craft. I guess I thought it would be much more difficult to manage the kayak by myself, but it's easy!
reviews.title: Easier and better than I imagined

reviews.text: Nice and light, easy to carry for one person. The single skeg underneath is tall and really helps keep kayak straight. There are two ports to inflate, one for the bottom and one for both sides. The insert for foot stability was unexpected but was useful to keep water from collecting on top. It required a different (provided) nozzle to inflate. It is a standard port you would find on a pool float. The seat had the same port unfortunately. It is not easy to deflate as it needs manual (pinch) help. Also there is no drain to remove water that gets inside. Mine came with the oar, a small patch kit, and a bag that might not hold up, but works for now. The material seems very durable. We kayak with a 15 pound dog who goes in and out without trouble or damage.
reviews.title: Great, fun, kayak... Great choice for the $

reviews.text: Easy, fun, maybe 10-15 set up, the. Hours of fun, relaxation, freedom. 10/10 would buy again. Now my bf is getting one so we don't have to take turns, i was worried, I'm about 200-220 lbs, the max weight for these, but the ride great, no issues, it held me, and I even got some speed up....doooo it...love that it deflated and I can put in my small car and take anywhere..!!
reviews.title: Good vibes

reviews.text: I just bought my second one. I got it on sale at the store and then everyone wanted turns on it. It held me great and Im probably maxing out the weight limit. My partner had a hard time sharing so I had to get another one before our next camping trip. Fingers crossed it comes in time
reviews.title: Great little kayak

reviews.text: Love it! I actually bought three so my kids and I could all go kayaking! We practiced inflating and deflating once at home and we were ready to go. The hardest part is getting it deflated enough to get it in the bag, but I currently have three - all in their bags in my garage. Do it- buy these!
reviews.title: Great fun! Good quality!

reviews.text: First time Kayaker and this things were really fun, great to take on trips as they dont take up much room and seem to last with the thick vinyl they are made of, I also own 2 of the K2 versions and the feel much roomier soI would gladly pay extra for a longer version (Talking to you Intex) but I will purchase again once I ware these out.
reviews.title: Lots of fun for adults and kids

reviews.text: I had my worries about an inflatable kayak, but this has been one of the best purchases I've made. It's easy to set up. It takes about ten minutes. I love that it is so compact and I don't need a roof rack to haul it around. I wish it had better instructions and maybe a drain to get excess water out. Otherwise it's a great kayak!
reviews.title: Perfect Affordable and Easy Kayak

reviews.text:
Easy to transport and abut t minutes to inflate and get in the water. 
Love it

This is an amazing kayak at an amazing price! It is easy to set up and take down, and portable, so you don't need a big car or any special equipment. I take my kayak out at least 3 times a week. The only downside that I have experienced is with leaks. My first Inter developed a leak within the first month. This one has a very slow leak, and I am hoping it holds.
reviews.title: Great deal!

reviews.text: Does not allow you to sit up straight.  I have been trying to return but of course, Walmart are giving me the run around and making it virtually IMPOSSIBLE to do so.  I would not advise you purchase this from Walmart in case you SUFFER the same problems I did.  They really need to make a return to the store possible during COVID 19 as this has made my life so much more difficult.  I guess that is $140 a I have LOST!
reviews.title: DON'T DO IT!!

reviews.text: I really LOVE my new kayak!  It arrived quickly, super quick and easy set up and tear down.  I can toss it in my trunk or back seat.  A definite thumbs-up!
Its a snug fit. Would be great for a child. I am a woman, 5. 7 1/2 inches tall. Had been using a fiberglass kayak. This inflatable is light for lifting. Pretty sturdy.
reviews.title: Nice for an inflatable

reviews.text: This item shipped quicker than expected. Its easy to inflate and really fun to use. Great for non experienced kayakers when don't want to lug around a hard body kayak.

So easy to step up! Took only 20 minutes the first time, just truing to figure everything out. Came in very nice packaging too. I highly recommend if you want to do easy paddles around a lake or calm body of water.
reviews.title: Great purchase!

reviews.text: Kayak is very good when used for few times but all of sudden two cracks in the material appeared and started losing air. Not durable material I guess or I got the bad piece. I had to return it. It did not last for even a month.
reviews.title: nice kayak but cheap not durable material

reviews.text: Portability is the best reason to purchase an inflatable kayak.  I feel secure in this kayak on a small lake, on a calm day.  Paddle works great, unit inflates at about 10 pumps with hand pump.  Price point is very good for the product.
reviews.title: Portability is jey

reviews.text: This kayak was very easy to set up and works really well. We took it out on Lake Michigan, keeping close to the shoreline. Definitely recommend using the rudder that slides into the bottom for that type of water for stability.
reviews.title: Great purchase, easy to set up and a joy to use.

reviews.text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] needs a little more foot room a plastic cowelle in foot well to keep it from closing in so tight other than that great little inflatable kayak
reviews.title: i would buy another one

reviews.text:
Comes complete.  Inflated very quickly, deflates even faster.  I am a 5-foot tall senior I can carry it easily in the carrying bag or even inflated.

Had it out several times on local lakes, terrific, peaceful lots of fun!
Was well worth the price.
reviews.title: Relaxing, active pastime.

reviews.text:
Overall a really great product for the price! I've used it once and paddling was fine on a calm lake. Easy to inflate and carry. The cargo net is great. I am 5 feet 2 inches and fit well - I can't imagine someone much taller would be comfortable.

I had one issue. Before I took it to the lake I inflated it at home. The small plastic ring that holds the valve cover broke off, which means that cover becomes a separate piece when not screwed in. I did leave the cover at home and had to return for it. Of course now its in my mind to remember that, but it was a small hassle and if the plastic were stronger it wouldn't have happened.
reviews.title: Great first-time kayak for a great price!

reviews.text: Purchased them for our grandkids! Perfect! I like that they hold 130 pounds. We bought three more.  We have had one since last summer and it was a huge hit!
reviews.title: Lightweight but sturdy

reviews.text: I ordered this kayak after seeing a fleet of them at my five-year-old daughter's camp, and seeing how easily they were paddled by kids 5-10 years old. The stability is excellent, when swimming my daughter can pull herself on to it, and even the paddle is decently high quality. The handle on the front makes it easy to attach to my kayak with a rope, so I can pull her around if she gets tired. We attached the rope to a carabiner, so she can attach it herself while we're on the lake. Yesterday we had three little girls on it and it did fine. If you get more than one, they stack nicely. Can't believe it's this inexpensive.
reviews.title: Superb kayak for 5-10 year olds

reviews.text: Super light. Durable. Easy to use. Perfect for the little ones who aren't quite big enough for a real kayak yet. My son is 6 and zooms all over the place on it. Crosses the lake, navigates salt water ways and creeks, and small enough to pack in the SUV versus on top of the roof.
reviews.title: My son (&. I) LOVE this!

reviews.text: We purchased one for each of our children, ages 5 and 7.  My 5 year old daughter is tall for her age.  Both kids were maneuvering their kayaks within minutes.  They even paddled with a friend sitting behind them.  Lightweight which makes it easy to transport and when they get a little older they will be able to carry them on their own.  The kayak is very stable, and the kids were able to jump off and get back on easily.  I definitely recommend it for people who's kids are comfortable in the water.
reviews.title: Kids love it!

reviews.text: This kayak has been my daughter's first venture into the water - it's just right for her rookie abilities, and she caught a peacock bass on Day 1. 5 stars.
reviews.title: Perfect First Kayak

reviews.text: I bought one of these for each of my two boys when they were 5 years old.  They love paddling around on lakes, reservoirs, ponds, and the Pamlico Sound.  These are very stable and easy for kids to paddle.  It makes them proud to have their own boats just like dad.  We like these well enough that I bought a second pair to leave in Tennessee.
reviews.title: These are great little boats

reviews.text: Exactly as described in product description.  Perfect for either my 6, 9, and 10 year old. Max capacity on kayak says 130lbs.
reviews.title: Great Kids kayak

reviews.text: It's a great little kayak!
reviews.title: 18 Pounds

reviews.text: My six year old great grandson loves it. He is becoming quite proficient in it in just the week he has had it. It's light enough he can pull it the lake landing site.
reviews.title: Great for small kids

reviews.text: I ordered this for my son, who is 4 1/2 and he loves it! We put him in the pool to test it out and he is ready for the river. Nice, solid construction and nice that it comes with the paddle and backrest. Very light to move around.
reviews.title: Perfect kayak for young children.

reviews.text: Great kids kayak!  My kids use it everyday and love it.  Durable and it fits in my car (SUV) for easy transport.  Thrilled that Sam’s had these in stock and had the best price by far.
reviews.title: Perfect kayak for kids!

reviews.text: My kids absolutely love these! The size is perfect for them ( 5yo & 7yo) to paddle them selves and steer well! We get asked about them all the time, a few of their friends have gotten one as well!
reviews.title: Great price for a great product!

reviews.text: Very well built and light weight. A 107 lb., 160 lb. and two children 6 yr and 4yr tried it out. It was a lot of fun. Easy to maneuver. Kids took to it right away and looked like pros.
reviews.title: Quality kayak for a great price

reviews.text: Shipped fast (these are NEVER available in store) and with no damage. Great bot for the kids. I added some handles and a seat for comfort as these come very basic (boat and paddle).
reviews.title: Fun little boat

reviews.text: Great stable kayak for kids. They can easily get back on from year platform. In our case, the platform is great for placing an anchor. My grandkids can pick up the anchor, change locations, to explore. This kayak, unlike first kayak I purchased, has hooks to tie ropes or other gear to. Paddles are sturdy.
reviews.title: Hours of fun

reviews.text: Solid boat my daughter loves it!
reviews.title: It will last more than a lifetime

reviews.text: My grand children and their parents love it! The kids can carry them and really enjoy them!! Hours of fun on their pond.
reviews.title: Kayak Fun for kids!

reviews.text: Great little kayak for little kids. When they say 130 pound limit they mean it! My eight-year-old and small 11-year-old fit perfectly
reviews.title: Great kayak for children 5 to 10 Years old

reviews.text: Proved to be just what we were looking for.  Was surprised how fast the grandkids were able to master it.  They were so proud to be on the lake in their own kayak.
reviews.title: The grandkids loved it!

reviews.text: My daughter is 8 years old & this kayak is perfect!!! She absolutely loves it. Our 1st kayaking together we went down the Blackstone River!!! It was so much fun.. I have told all her school friend's & we all plan on kayaking together this summer!! Great little kayak!!!
reviews.title: Youth Kayak

reviews.text: We have always loved the idea of taking the kids out for kayaking, but who wants to lug one of these things around-or store one? We were fishing and saw a family with this and we bought it that same day. It is large with comfy seats that velcro and buckle into place. It comes with a pump and takes quite a while to fill this with air, but it is so worth it. The oars are simple to snap together and are secure. The seats were comfy, even with our life jackets..plenty of room (for two people <300 lbs total). The oars are not the most comfy, especially after about 5 minutes of rowing..they could do with better grips, but for the price, what you get is what you need for a fantastic time on the lake. We were caught by some currents and I was surprised at how nicely we were able to stay in control and maneuver with this kayak and the oars. It was smooth sailing and easy (and fast) to deflate and toss in the car. I am so pleased with this purchase. The kids had a great time and so did we.
reviews.title: Accessible Fun on the Lake!

reviews.text: Love it! Great buy! Super fast shipping! Just what we needed to take to our beach house at OBX NC. It works best for us because it's portable, we can take it anywhere and put it away without taking up a lot of room. Kids can't get enough of it (ages 11 and 8). So far we have used it on the ocean side with our life vest. Best purchase ever!!! Thank You! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
reviews.title: Best purchase ever, for the money!

reviews.text: Came ahead of schedule. The included pump inflated the floor and 2 large hull chambers very quickly.  The bow and stern areas were easy fills. The seats are adjustable and comfy and I'm over 6 feet tall. The paddles alone are $35 each if bought separate. So the cost of both is almost equal to the price of the whole kayak! Great value and many great YouTube reviews!
reviews.title: Intex K2 Explorer

reviews.text: Super easy to air up. Hand pump supplied works amazingly well for fast inflating. Was worried that after I used it, I wouldn't be able to get it back in the bag but it deflates easy enough. Took it out in the gulf a few times. Seems sturdy and durable. After just a handful of uses already felt I got my money's worth.
reviews.title: Well worth it

reviews.text: Besides the instructions not being quite clear, after inflating several times, weve got a system down. It inflates very quickly, much quicker than the deflate. I do wish the center had Boston plugs as well. We have taken it out in semi-swift waters, windy/choppy waters and calm lake water. It handled well in all but would definitely recommend using the detachable fin on every trip. No issues so far after 4 trips.
reviews.title: great buy

reviews.text: This was our very first kayak and we love it! We have 3 young kids. I am able to take both of our older two (3 and 7) out at the same time. It's surprisingly sturdy and stabile for being inflatable. Although it's a bit of a bear to get back in the bag (tip: a battery air pump comes in handy to get more air out of the kayak), it's nice to not have to worry about buying a rack for the traditional kind. I also liked that it comes with everything you need so you don't have to buy oars separate as well. If you're looking to try kayaking out, this one is definitely a great value for the quality and price!
reviews.title: Great Beginner

reviews.text: Amazing kayak for the price. super fast shipping.
reviews.title: Amazing kayak

reviews.text:
I did about a months research on a few different inflatable kayaks and always came to this one.

I was a little Leary about buying it, because of where I would be using it. There tends to be high plant growth hiding just at water level which tends to be hard to see at times. I was concerned about getting a hole in bottom of kayak.
Luckily one day I had been at the area where I want to use this and came across to guys who were using the same kayak! I got to see first hand what it was like before I bought it!

So I bought it the next day! I just used it and I have no regrets. Lots of room, Max Weight is 400lbs.
Oars are ok but are not long enough. I purchase a 96 inch paddle by shoreline. Which I recommend. Easy to inflate and doesn't take long. Since it was just me and alot of camera equipment I didn't bother putting second seat in. I am tall and had alot of room.
The skeg even after running over a low area did not fall off. Steering is pretty good .

All in all I think it is rated the best! Well worth it.
reviews.title: Great compact kayak for money!

reviews.text: We got this boat hoping it would fit the 2 of us and our 6 yr old... it did, and without any problem! We even took our 50lb boxer for a spin in it, and his nails did not even mark the surface of the boat. With the scag in, it tracks quite nice. You sit out of the water enough to really get moving in quiet water. Love our new boat
reviews.title: Great little 2.5 person kayak with nice quality!

reviews.text: Looks great, arrived very quickly, sooner then expected. Unfortunately our plans changed and we didnt use it. But we hope to take it out soon. But the size and everything will be great
reviews.title: Very quick delivery

reviews.text:
Sturdy, easily inflatable kayak that's easy to set up and take down after a day of fun in the water. It comes with a case, repair kit, manual air pump and two oars that come apart for easy storage. Perfect for people that have limited space, small car or disabilities that do not permit having a hard shell kayak.
I gave it four stars because the skeg is very long and will not let you navigate in shallow water. Not fun getting stuck and having to get out and drag the kayak. I ordered a smaller skeg off of ebay for this reason. I checked Intex's website and they offer no alternative or smaller skeg and when I called the company directly, the young lady on the other end was of no use and in no mood to answer two simple questions. She had no grasp of the products they sell, whatsoever. With that being said, for under $100 and if you can catch high tide, you're in business.
reviews.title: Rugged, sturdy Kayak

reviews.text:
I paid $2.97 extra for shipping to get it on 4/11/14. Actually got it on 4/14/14.

You can't go wrong with an Intex product. I have used the River Run 1 for the past 5 years and consider it the best inner tube there is. I felt it was time to upgrade.

The features I like about the K2 Explorer are:
1) The 2 hulls have separate air chambers.
2) Its self bailing. No dumping out water
3) All the extras that come in the package.
4) 36 inches wide compared to the other models being 30 to 33 inches wide.
reviews.title: Dollar for dollar, best inflatable kayak on market

reviews.text: I don't have much experience kayaking, but bought this for kayaking in the mangroves. This is great quality for the price. I felt very safe in it (no worries about popping or tipping), it blows up very easily, and is a great solution for people who want to kayak but are low on funds and space.
reviews.title: Great kayak for beginners!

reviews.text:
For the price this is a great purchase.

I have to agree with other comments on this product about the paddles, they seem to be a little weak if you really dig in while rowing. The paddles are 5 pieces that disconnect to fit into the travel bag, which is a plus for storage and transportation. They should be fine for average rowing but I was rowing upstream against the current and wind and could feel some give to the joints of the paddle. 

As for the kayak, my only complaint is that the seam is on the top of the tubes and my hand was irritated as they slid down the seam as I paddled. 

I had read complaints that the kayak wouldn't maintain a straight line but I found it very easy to navigate and maintain my intended line. It was also surprisingly stable. I am over 250 pounds and I had my daughter with me at around 75 pounds. We were both easily able to enter and exit the kayak and I switched between my daughter and younger son a few times without issue. 

I was a little concerned about an inflatable kayak, mainly due to durability. On the first trip out we got hung up on a submerged tree, just under the water line. I checked the kayak out thoroughly and couldn't even find a scuf mark on the underside. 

I had also read complaints on the pump which is included. It feels light and cheap but I had brought my electric air pump and found the air pump that is included was much faster than the electric pump. The kayak inflated rather quickly but there are several sections that need to be inflated so it does take a little time. 

Overal I believe this is a great purchase.
reviews.title: Great purchase

reviews.text: This boat is awesome, especially for such a great price. NOt cheapy like I expected and the paddles are really nice too. We used it on the river all summer. Pumps up really fast. Easy to carry. Easy to deflate. My tweens LOVED it. It was better to deal with then my 800$ boat. I wouldnt take it on super rocky class 3 rapids because its not that tough but it was sure good enough for a fun ride on easier waves etc.

Wanted to try kayaking on a limited budget. This was the answer! I can get this kayak inflated and ready for the water in about 15 minutes. Once on the water it performed well, is quite stable, and keeps 100% inflated. We took it out on a lake with no current but we still had wakes from the other watercraft in the area and we didn't have difficulty cutting through those. We paddled for over 2 miles the first day out and loved it! Can deflate and pack it in just a few minutes. Took longer to dry it off than to pack it! Highly recommend one!
reviews.title: Great and economical

reviews.text:
At $96 and free shipping, this falls into the "no brainer" category. Being so inexpensive, I was a little cautious about it and did not let my expectations get too high. I got the package and all was there. I inflated it last night to make sure that it did not loose any air overnight. This morning it was still fully inflated - no leaks. Deflated it, took it to a waterfront park access to a tidal river. Inflated and in the water paddling within 10 minutes of arriving at the dock.
It paddled very well and was faster than I expected. I was paddling against ~ a 2 kt current and a slight breeze and was able to easily cover a good distance in a half hour. I estimate that I could comfortably do about 4 to 5 kts over a long period of time in zero current water.
The steg seems to work very well. I noticed that a few reviews were critical of the skeg since they stated that the steg is susceptible to coming off. I don' know if this was something that Intex did anything about , but the steg on my kayak connects VERY Snugly and LOCKS in place. I can't comprehend how the steg on the kayak that I have would fall off or be knocked loose by hitting something.
I paddled solo, with the back seat moved up to the center as far a possible in the range of adjustment. The seat was reasonably comfortable. The back support is adequate, but not as good as a rigid kayak with a more expensive seat. My rating does not indicate that I think that it is comparable in performance to a rigid kayak, but for what it is, an inflatable, low cost, very portable boat, it delivers very well. I have not paddled any other inflatable kayak models or brands, but I would have a hard time believing that any other inflatable kayak would perform much better than this one.
This is my second Intex product. I also have the Seahawk 2 and have caught many fish from that inflatable boat. The Seahawk 2 rows very well.
If you are apartment bound without room (or budget) for a traditional boat, but would really like to get on the water, this the the boat for you!
reviews.title: Delivers as advertised!

reviews.text: so sturdy and roomy. Plenty of room for two adults, a dog, and a cooler. Easy to manuver, use it for touring around the harbor. Surprised how fast it inflated. Searched the internet, this seemed to have the best reviews and they were right. Walmart.com is for sure the cheapest anywhere, by far!
reviews.title: incredible!

reviews.text: The kids loved it! Went camping and they all were on the lake all day. At one point we had 4 kids inside and 2 hanging on the outside! Like other reviewers,  the oars were not amazing, a lot of water got in the kayak from them. But we were in the water, so not a huge deal.  The seats did not provide a lot of back  support, so do not expect much. But so far, it was a great purchase.  Takes a little time to let the air out of all rhe chambers, the kids loved helping. Hopefully when we unroll it next, it will be just as great.
reviews.title: Great purchase

reviews.text: This is a bargain.  Works super well, and have already taken it on our lake a bunch of times.  It does take some effort to inflate and deflate, so if you're using it a lot it's best to keep it stored in a garage inflated.  Very portable and perfect for trips!
reviews.title: Great Deal

reviews.text: Great kayak and paddle. Suggest you buy paddle drip ring to help prevent water running down your paddle getting you wet, but everything else is wonderful.
reviews.title: Nice smooth, balanced ride! Well made. Looks great

reviews.text: For a beginner kayaker, for the price, its a great starter kayak.  I have added a modifications and it is very comfortable and looking forward to many fishing trips.
reviews.title: Excellent buy

reviews.text: Absolutely love this thing. Best kayak for the money. The seat however isnt comfortable but can be upgraded easily.
reviews.title: Amazing kayak

reviews.text: Great Durable kayak. has water drain holes so you can fall off and get back on and water drains out.  Had Shipped to Key Colony Beach and shipper was prompt and called ahead and was smooth delivery to our Vacation Rental in Middle Florida Keys.  Putting in and out of Sea Wall people are rough on them and these are durable. would buy again.
reviews.title: Great Durable kayaks for our Vacation Rental.

reviews.text: Arrived way ahead of schedule. no hassle delivery. no damage.  this thing is awesome!
reviews.title: May the fish fear me now!

reviews.text: Love the Tamarack, but had to be delivered twice with the first one having a hole in the hull, totally inoperable, and the second delivery was damaged and scuffed all over the side and top.  Since it would float, I took delivery, but very disappointed in the two different shipping companies used by Walmart.  The boat is great, just wish Walmart compensated me for a non-new condition product.
reviews.title: Great boat, damaged on delivery-TWICE!

reviews.text:
Kayak is as described.  Arrived complete with all pieces, paddles, rod holders.  Its light and easy to carry and load/unload alone.  Cheaper than buying directly from lifetime.  Stable, tracks well, and a perfect little beginner fishing kayak.


With that being said, if you order from Walmart and the item comes via freight like these expect a shipping nightmare.  Pilot freight scheduled my appointment via email, without consulting us, whatever.  I confirmed the appointment and took the day off of work since the delivery window was 12 hours.  No call no show all day long.  30 minutes before the revert window was up I received an email stating they moved the delivery to the following day.  This was at 7:30pm.   Since they would not answer the phone, I fired off an email stating I would not be home because I had to work the next day, which was a Friday.   They said someone would get in contact to reschedule.  Monday I receive a call from pilot freight saying they only have one of the two kayaks that we ordered, and the other was lost.  After an exhaustive search, they did not know where it was.  They wanted to schedule another delivery for the one kayak they had, we declined and told them to call when they are ready to deliver both.  Again they said they had lost one, and couldn't find it.   Immediately contacted Walmart to report this and get the situation remedied.  Customer service was completely unhelpful and unwilling to help.  They obviously could not grasp the concept that one of the two kayaks has been lost by the shipper, even after a conference call with all parties.   So the wait begins.   After another week and no updates, I get a call from another delivery company to schedule an appointment on a Thursday, whatever, we set it up.   Wednesday I get a call that the driver is 30 minutes from my house. I work 45 miles away,  I managed to get off and rush home.
Nothing signed for, wrapping completely destroyed, but the kayaks were in good shape.


If you order these from here, don't be surprised if the shipping turns into a nightmare.
We receive several large freight shipments a year and have never had issues like this.  After reviewing Pilot Freights and Walmarts  reviews, I shouldn't have been surprised.    Will never order from Walmart again.
reviews.title: Decent kayaks, horrible horrible horrible shipping

reviews.text:
Not because of the kayak quality but because you don't know what you will get and when you are going to get it! I ordered the blue one and after a month I got a totally different kayak, which you can see in the photos.
Also the shipping was weird too! I set an appointment online and they ended up calling me for drop off a week earlier and at a time that didn't work for me, so I had to ask my neighbor to watch for it while it was sitting outside my house! I ended up returning the kayak the same day and get a full refund.
reviews.title: Just don't bother!

reviews.text: Arrived split at seem where kayak is bonded Where deck and hull meet super upset w quality And then had to load up yack to return in person after waiting weeks I recommend getting in person I was afraid of how the yack would arrive and just as I thought it got trashed in freight delivery
reviews.title: Was so exited till arrived split !!!

reviews.text: This kayak was damaged, I want to revive a kayak that I don't have to repair.  This is the second one to arrive damaged!!
reviews.title: Sick of recovering damaged kayaks!

reviews.text: I wanted a kayak that would easily handle my golden retriever as my companion. I would have kids and other adults also, but mostly the dog.
reviews.title: Dog worthy

reviews.text: Bought two. Delivery by Pilot Freight went great, no damages! Comfortable and quite a balanced ride. Nice paddle, but buy drip rings ( not costly) for it or water will run down paddle and get you very wet! Very happy with purchasing these!
reviews.title: Great kayak! Highly recommend!

reviews.text: The quality control could be better. The webbing on the right side carry handle is frayed half way through . Hopefully I can find replacement webbing that will fit .
reviews.title: frayed webbing

reviews.text:
During this quarantine it seemed recreational items were on short supply I kept looking back on this kayak looking for a different color besides green . I finally found it one day in blue/black and bought it online on the spot . Had to pay extra for freight since they wouldnt ship To store  Wish they could deliver without person to person delivery but I understand . Well super excited it was going to arrive , it finally did , and it was green !!! I was 100% sure I had ordered blue I called customer service they too verified I had ordered blue but said unfortunately they were none available and would not be able to tell me if and when . All sold out in every color but green in surrounding areas needless to say I was very disappointed 
Offered to email me when any other color was available and 15% discount which didnt even cover freight. Overall doesnt look terrible was bigger than. I anticipated Im 5ft tall not sure how well Ill do carrying it but well see

Finally arrived (5 weeks after order date) and arrived DAMAGED.  Apparently very common when purchasing through Walmart.  Read all the one star reviews and you see a reoccurring pattern of Kayaks arriving with a deep gash or hole that occurred during shipping.  The shipping company(Pilot Freight) stated they had multiple Kayaks on their dock.  The majority with tracking labels or customer names ripped off or shredded. They were having to try and match invoices with actual orphaned products.  It was also just in a lightweight plastic bubble wrap bag.
 Yes, it was the cheapest price even with the $70 freight shipping added however not worth the hassle.  Buyer Beware
reviews.title: Arrived Damaged - Took 5 weeks - Not worth the Has

reviews.text: I am very pleased on how stable this kayak is.
reviews.title: My first fishing kayak

reviews.text: I love the kayak just what I wanted. The rod holder was missing, I did get reimbursed but I want everything that is included.
reviews.title: Lifetime tamarack angler

reviews.text: took longer to get than what was stated then came damaged I just dont want to take more time to send back,haven't tried yet
reviews.title: Is what it is

reviews.text: There are several part of the kayak has some kind damage ( scratch ). The price was good, and the shipping was quick.

Purchased this kayak about a year ago and have used it nearly 20 times on several lake and rivers. Could not ask for a better fishing kayak. It's reasonably priced, very stable and has plenty of room for all my gear.  Lifetime is a great company as well.  I contacted them after I unfortunately did not screw my storage cap on tightly enough and it flew off during one of my trips.  With no questions asked they are sending me a new one free of charge! Plan on buying my next kayak from them in the future.
reviews.title: Awesome Kayak!

reviews.text: This kayak is everything and more... because of the COVID pandemic it was very hard to find any kayak let alone a Lifetime  kayak. All of the reviews Ive seen on YouTube were that although its inexpensive its definitely a good kayak. Its not fast, but as an angler an leisure kayak it really fits the bill. The seat is very comfortable and the foot stays are easily adjustable. The only complaint is that the paddle that comes with it is too small. For the width of the boat it should be about 10 inches longer. Other than that, its an awesome boat!
reviews.title: Great kayak!!

reviews.text: I haven't put it on water yet but love the design and features. The only issue I have is from the delivery. Kayak arrived with scuff marks all over it and deep scratches on the bottom where the delivery driver I assume dragged it down my concrete drive. He also marked it as signed by me and left in my drive. I didn't know it had arrived until I returned home in the evening. Had it been stolen, I would not have known it was delivered at all.
reviews.title: Expensive delivery for what you get!

reviews.text: The primary reason I purchased the Tamarack Pro 103 kayak was the seat. It's very comfortable and adjustable, and suspended over the deck. The kayak is very stable and easily movable on the water.   The opening for the tackle storage in front of the seat isn't wide enough to insert a tackle tray, the seat would have to be lifted to access the area, but makes a good place for an extra tackle tray if not needing to access the area often. For the included paddle, it has not been used yet to review and does not come with drip rings. Overall, the Tamarack Pro is everything I need.
reviews.title: Lifetime Tamarack Pro 103

reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these kayaks and paid $70/ for freight. Both were wrapped in plastic and both seemed fine. Unwrap your kayak before you take receipt. One just had scratches, but the other one was split at the seem with a dent above where something hit it to break the plastic weld at the seem. @walmart.com needs to do something about the shipping agents as I have read most come damaged. I would like to get my freight cost back but do not know where to start. I welded to fix because of back order and a the other kayak was good. This kayak is awesome! More than worth the money, just get a better paddle and check out thoroughly before driver leaves.
reviews.title: Damaged kayak @walmart should refund my freight!

reviews.text:
I'm a big guy and this kayak handles me great I have three fishing poles out with me at all times only kicker is the paddle but still works you can just pickup and go
I recommend this for any levels I'm a first time kayaker
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: Bought this 2 months ago and have 1/2 dozen trips on the water.   Added fishfinder and a 6" hull access in the stern for my battery.   Super happy with the size, weight, and maneuverability.   Great customer service! - 2 small issues that customer service took care of very quickly.
reviews.title: Awesome Kayak!

reviews.text:
I need another one! Took it out on the bay it handled and tracked like a champ! It surfed no problem extremely stableI the hull design even lets you stand . If you see one in stock anywhere? Do not hesitate its great for the price, and all the add ons are a super plus lifetime lIstens to their customers. Yes the paddle is not the best, but at least it comes with one! 
Please let me know when you get more in stock i want two more!!

A great kayak at a great price. I have rented several kayaks over the years but really wanted my own not only for all purpose kayaking but specifically for fishing. This is perfect. Lightweight and built well. Its set up quite well for fishing with the bait container easily accessible and the three rod holders that come with it. The seat seems a little questionable in terms of durability and there were a few issues with items missing that have yet to be resolved by manufacturer so time will tell about customer service. Overall though, this is a great value.
reviews.title: Great fishing kayak

reviews.text: We love the kayaks. They are exactly what my wife and I were looking for. We did have an issue with one of the kayaks arriving with what looked like a large puncture from a forklift. Due to the long delay in receiving a replacement, I decided to keep the damaged kayak and was comfortable with the discount that was offered due to the damage. Fortunately, the damage was above the waterline so, after a little time and effort, I felt good about putting it on the water. I understand the challenges that companies face with reduced staff and increased online orders, but, more care should be taken on items that are already in short supply.
reviews.title: Love the Kayak, but...

reviews.text: Ordered two, one arrived damaged, mainly because Walmart sent them not packaged well AT ALL. Tried to get a replacement they were out of stock. Agreed to have it picked up and my money refunded, however both the delivery service and pick up service have been awful. Still waiting for the damaged one to be picked up, Walmart customer service has been awful to deal with. Still no solution, will never use Walmart again.
reviews.title: AWFUL CUSTOMER SERVICE

reviews.text: piece junk. poor layout. footwells, paddle is junk, big molding ares that make difficult placement of items. no dry storage area,they all connect to inside of hull that can get lost in entire length of kayak. just stupid poor design  . hey its cheap that why people buy em.
reviews.title: poor cheap quality.

reviews.text: I ordered 2 kayaks to have delivered to my daughter.  There was a missing part.  I went online and chatted with Randy.  Problem solved within 5 mins.  My daughter said the kayaks look really nice!!   I cant wait to go to Michigan next year to use them!
reviews.title: Getting missing part

reviews.text: Just delivered today. It was wrapped completely in thick bubble wrap and arrived without any damage. I looked at MANY, and I decided on the Lifetime Tamarack Pro based on video reviews and features, especially the seat and the adjustable foot braces. Lifetime sells this for $599. I received an email alert that it was back in stock at Wal-Mart. I had to pay $60 to $70 for shipping, but no complicating issues there. Look forward to taking it out. This is my first kayak. The page on this website says "paddle included" and I did not receive one with it.  Another question. It did not come with the "triple threat rod holder" but the accessory is featured in all the marketing materials, as if it is a standard item included. Should I have received one? Seems to be a solid kayak with promise.
reviews.title: First kayak, delivered today

reviews.text: We had out first voyage and I must say this is a awesome kayak it glides smoothly through the water and was great for fishing we put a 8 lb anchor and it held both kayaks in the river
reviews.title: So much fun

reviews.text: The color is awesome.  In the water its very sluggish and hard to handle even in calm water.  The paddle is really cheap and very flexible not worth using, highly suggest buying a new one before going on the water.  Price point is great!
reviews.title: Quality material and paint is awesome.

reviews.text: The boat seems OK.  I haven't gotten it in the water yet, but it is everything it claimed to be.  However, when I received it there were three fairly large gouges in the hull.  I believe these are from improper handling during shipping.  Totally unacceptable.
reviews.title: Poor shipping

reviews.text: The kayak came with multiple scratches and nicks all over it. And it was not from the delivery because it was all in bubble wrap you guys sent me the kayak from the warehouse like that very disappointed. And it was not from the delivery because it was all in bubble wrap you guys sent me the kayak from the warehouse like that very disappointed

The seat is very comfortable, that is the main reason I bought this Kayak, as I can spend ours in it and don't want a sore back. I loe the colors, thought i wanted blue but this color was the only available so I am very pleasd as I like it much better than the blue.  It is very stabile, you can stand in it!  With the paddle included and easy delivery I am a happy shoper.
reviews.title: Good looking and comfortable.

reviews.text: I bought a kayak that arrived without a fishing rod holder so I contacted Lifetime's customer service to see if I could get another one and what would be the cost. They got back to me pretty quickly given the fact they are working weird hours because of Covid-19. They solved my problem immediately!  Could not ask for better service. Thank you, Lifetime!
reviews.title: Great Customer service!

reviews.text: First off this kayak is beautiful...love the color combo and is very comfortable with the seat it came with...I went on lifetimes page and almost bought the same one for $600 until I saw it at Walmart for $400 and quickly purchased...well worth the extra $69 for shipping as it was the cheapest shipping available from any other store to deliver kayaks and has every option you need plus comes with a rod holder that I absolutely love...highly recommend!!!
reviews.title: In Love!!!
